page.title: 13VALE ROYAL ABBEY, WHITEGATE
page.content: The 708-year old abbey was originally a Cistercian monastery until it was bought by Edward 1. There are over 100 rooms and one of the main rooms is the Great Hall. The ceiling is covered with the coats of arms of the Cholmondeleys and the families they married into. Pulleys raise and lower the candelabra from the ceiling. Another important room is the Dining Hall which has an Italian door. Now the private owner intends to convert the Abbey into approximately 16 luxury flats to finance the renovation. This will take 2 years or more. The Great Hall is used mainly for functions such as banquets and weddings. Even when part of the Abbey is rented the Great Hall will always be available to be seen by appointment.
